Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a drab-coloured pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394658) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394658)
